Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SyCPA 116 (collimosyn; chemically synthetic AMPs20; XXL, fatty acid cyclized lipopeptide, lactam, XXJ, UCSB1e)
Sequence Information.Source: bioinformatic predicted bacterial nonribosomal gene cluster,Collimonas fungivoransTer331, bacteria-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: the peptide was predicted but made in a different way.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (44.44%) toCr-ACP1Chemical modification: 3-aminotetradecanoic acid is attached to the N-terminus of the peptide. The amide on the fatty acid chain is then formed an amide bond with the C-terminus of the peptide. Residues L1 and T2 are D-amino acids (XXD2).Activity: active against B. subtilis 168 1A1 (MIC 8 ug/ml), E. faecium Com15 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. aureus USA300 (MIC 4 ug/ml), E-coli DH5alpha (MIC>64 ug/ml), K-pneumoniae ATCC 10031 (MIC>64 ug/ml), A-baumannii ATCC 17978 (MIC>64 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa PAO1 (MIC>64 ug/ml), E-cloacae ATCC 14037 (MIC>64 ug/ml), M-tuberculosis H37RV (MIC>12.5 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Chu J, Koirala B, Forelli N, Vila-Farres X, Ternei MA, Ali T, Colosimo DA, Brady SF. 2020
Literature Information.Title: Synthetic-Bioinformatic Natural Product Antibiotics with Diverse Modes of Action.
